context.content: In computer science, a hash function is any function that can be used to map data of arbitrary size to fixed-size values. The values returned by a hash function are called hash values, hash codes, digests, or simply hashes.
Hash functions are used in many applications including hash tables, data integrity verification, and cryptography. Cryptographic hash functions must fulfill additional security requirements.
A neural network is a series of algorithms that attempts to recognize underlying relationships in a set of data through a process that mimics the way the human brain operates.
The architecture of a neural network includes layers of nodes, each resembling a neuron, with each node connected to several others in the adjacent layers.
JSON, or JavaScript Object Notation, is a lightweight data-interchange format. It is easy for humans to read and write, and easy for machines to parse and generate.
JSON is built on two structures: a collection of name/value pairs and an ordered list of values. These are realized as objects and arrays in most programming languages.

Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is a method of combining traditional information retrieval systems with generative models. It improves factual accuracy by grounding responses in external knowledge.
In RAG, retrieved documents or document chunks are concatenated with the user's query and passed into a language model. This allows the model to condition its output on retrieved facts.
